thread.title: Donna Hay's nectarine and coconut tart recipe
thread.title_full: Donna Hay's nectarine and coconut tart recipe - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Donna Hay's nectarine and coconut tart recipe
text: Looking for a gourmet getaway? Discover delicious food and fine wine in Australia » This is a recipe from Donna Hay's cookbook the new easy Ingredients Serves four 1 sheet (200g) store-bought sweet shortcrust pastry 1 cup (75g) shredded coconut 1 eggwhite ¼ cup (55g) caster (superfine) sugar 2 nectarines, thinly sliced caster (superfine) sugar, extra, for sprinkling double (thick) cream, to serve Method Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Cut the pastry into a 24cm round and place on a baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper. Mix to combine the coconut, eggwhite and sugar and spread over the pastry, leaving a 1cm border. Top with the nectarine slices and fold over the edges of the pastry to form a border. Sprinkle with the extra sugar and bake for 16-20 minutes or until golden. Cut into wedges and serve hot or cold with double cream. You may also be interested in: • The best destination for food and wine • A Taste of Australia with Donna Hay • Donna Hay's caramelised chilli and salmon stir-fry recipe
